summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Persuasion 2007 [DVD]
Review Date: 2009/04/08
Store: Sally Hawkins  (Actor),     Alice Krige  (Actor),     Adrian Shergold  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, BBC, All BBC Titles
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'Persuasion 2007', 'Amazon.com', 'Jane Austen fans will delight in the sumptuous production design and first-rate acting in the 2007', 'Masterpiece Theatre', 'version of', 'Persuasion', '. Sally Hawkins is controlled and moving as Anne Elliot, the quietly heartbroken but sensible heroine who was "persuaded" (read: forced) to turn away her true love but still carries an unseen torch for him. Hawkins\'s performance is genteel yet steely, and the quiet strength of the entire production. Hawkins looks alternately quietly lovely and sadly pinched--as one might expect the long frustrated Anne to look.', 'Other highlights include a post-', 'Buffy', 'Anthony Head, as Anne\'s clueless, blustery father, Sir Walter. Head gets to turn on his deft comic talent here in ways most American audiences have not yet seen him; he\'s clearly enjoying himself immensely, blustering about "my shrubberies" and other trivial affairs. The cinematography is lush (several breathtaking tracking shots are used, especially early on), as are the period costumes. The production was filmed exclusively on location, and the reality of the sets enforces the story.', 'Some fans may prefer the', '1995 Amanda Root version', ', for the casting of Ciaran Hinds as Capt. Wentworth, but this later effort is a worthy entry in the Austen film oeuvre--and Rupert Penry-Jones is a dreamboat in his own right. As the wistful Anne says, on behalf of all women, "We do not forget you, so soon as you forget us." --', 'A.T. Hurley']
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Romance', 'Format': 'Closed-captioned, Color, DVD, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Michael Fenton Stevens, Marion Bailey, Simon Burke, Anthony Head, Jennifer Higham, Sally Hawkins, Peter Wight, Julia Davis, Mary Stockley, Adrian Shergold, Jane Austen, Alice Krige, Rosamund Stephen, Rupert Penry-Jones, Amanda HaleMichael Fenton Stevens, Marion Bailey, Simon Burke, Anthony Head, Jennifer Higham, Sally Hawkins, Peter Wight, Julia Davis, Mary Stockley, Adrian Shergold, Jane Austen, Alice Krige, Rosamund Stephen, Rupert Penry-Jones, Amanda Hale  See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Stereo), Unqualified', 'Number Of Discs': '1', 'Aspect Ratio': 'Unknown', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Package Dimensions': '7.4 x 5.3 x 0.8 inches; 6.4 Ounces', 'Director': 'Adrian Shergold', 'Media Format': 'Closed-captioned, Color, DVD, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 33 minutes', 'Release date': 'January 15, 2008', 'Actors': 'Sally Hawkins, Alice Krige, Rupert Penry-Jones, Anthony Head, Julia Davis', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'BBC Home Entertainment', 'Writers': 'Jane Austen, Simon Burke', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: This DVD is the classic Jane Austin's Persuasion that appeared on BBC. I got it for my mother-in-law who wanted this adaptation.  I watched it too--loved it.
Review Title: Jane Austin's Persuasion
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Angelique Collection
Review Date: 2009/12/21
Store: Michele Mercier  (Actor),     Jean Rochefort  (Actor),     Bernard Borderie  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Lionsgate Home Entertainment, All Lionsgate Titles
Product Description: ['Based on the best-selling French novels by Anne and Serge Golon that captured hearts worldwide, the ANGELIQUE films chronicle the life of an adventurous heroine in the Louis XIV era. Five classic film adaptations star the beautiful Michele Mercier and the dashing Robert Hossein as her husband and true love. A swashbuckling blend of action, intrigue and passion, the ANGELIQUE films seamlessly capture the amazing life of a French country girl whose quest for love and happiness leads her from the gutters of Paris to the Palaces Versailles. 3-Disc Set Includes: ANGELIQUE, ANGELIQUE: ROAD TO VERSAILLES, ANGELIQUE AND THE KING, UNTAMABLE ANGELIQUE, ANGELIQUE AND THE SULTAN']
Average Rating: 4.5
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Action & Adventure', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Color, Dolby, Full Screen, NTSC, Subtitled', 'Contributor': 'Claude Giraud, Robert Hossein, Jean Rochefort, Bernard Borderie, Sami Frey, Michele Mercier', 'Language': 'French, English', 'Runtime': '8 hours and 38 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.35:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'LGT22937DVD', 'Director': 'Bernard Borderie', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Color, Dolby, Full Screen, NTSC, Subtitled', 'Run time': '8 hours and 38 minutes', 'Release date': 'April 29, 2008', 'Actors': 'Michele Mercier, Jean Rochefort, Sami Frey, Robert Hossein, Claude Giraud', 'Dubbed': 'English', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish', 'Studio': 'Lions Gate', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: The Angelique series of French books were very popular in the 70's.  This French DVD set of five of the books made into film was fun to watch.
Review Title: Favorite From the Past
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Meek's Cutoff
Review Date: 2012/07/16
Store: Michelle Williams  (Actor),     Bruce Greenwood  (Actor),     Kelly Reichardt  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Drama
Average Rating: 3.4
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Westerns', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Full Screen, NTSC, Subtitled', 'Contributor': 'Will Patton, Zoe Kazan, Tommy Nelson, Shirley Henderson, Rod Rondeaux, Kelly Reichardt, Michelle Williams, Neal Huff, Paul Dano, Bruce GreenwoodWill Patton, Zoe Kazan, Tommy Nelson, Shirley Henderson, Rod Rondeaux, Kelly Reichardt, Michelle Williams, Neal Huff, Paul Dano, Bruce Greenwood   See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 44 minutes'}
Review Text: As a historian buff, I love seeing films on the Pacific Northwest--or in this case a film about the pioneers to the Pacific Northwest.  The film showing some of the families taking the "Meek Cutoff" is historically accurate.  It is more of an art film showing just a few families and their struggles.  Stephen Meek (brother of the famous Joseph Meek) had a "compass in his head" and thought he could save weeks of travel with his short cut.  However for the former trapper, it had been several years since he had taken that trail.  Now with all the wagons, cattle, and families and a drought year--Meek lost the trail and they wandered about for weeks, the total journey taking three months and the loss of lives, cattle, wagons. Accurate and well-done film, with the actors and actresses doing a very fine job of showing the lives of the people on that "Terrible Trail."
Review Title: Meek's Cutoff
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2013/08/30
Average Rating: 4.5
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Colleen Holub', 'Dallas Parker', 'Sylvain Lavoie'], 'Producers': ['Sarah Wall', 'Carol Greenwald', 'Chris Bartleman', 'Ken Scarborough', 'Blair Peters'], 'Studio': ['PBS']}
Review Text: The video Martha Speaks takes Martha on further adventures.  After you have read the books, this is a cute followup. Good for first —third graders.
Review Title: Martha Speaks
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2013/09/13
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['John Rowe', 'Koyalee Chanda', 'Alan Zdinak', 'Matt Sheridan', 'Todd Kessler', 'Nancy Keegan', 'Traci Paige Johnson', 'Lucy Walker', 'Bruce Caines', 'Elizabeth Holder'], 'Starring': ['Traci Paige Johnson', 'Michael Rubin', 'Aleisha Allen']}
Review Text: My 5 year old granddaughter liked it. I really is for the preschool kids. I watched it and enjoyed it.
Review Title: Cute for the preschool set.
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

['Product Description', 'Persuasion 2007', 'Amazon.com', 'Jane Austen fans will delight in the sumptuous production design and first-rate acting in the 2007', 'Masterpiece Theatre', 'version of', 'Persuasion', '. Sally Hawkins is controlled and moving as Anne Elliot, the quietly heartbroken but sensible heroine who was "persuaded" (read: forced) to turn away her true love but still carries an unseen torch for him. Hawkins\'s performance is genteel yet steely, and the quiet strength of the entire production. Hawkins looks alternately quietly lovely and sadly pinched--as one might expect the long frustrated Anne to look.', 'Other highlights include a post-', 'Buffy', 'Anthony Head, as Anne\'s clueless, blustery father, Sir Walter. Head gets to turn on his deft comic talent here in ways most American audiences have not yet seen him; he\'s clearly enjoying himself immensely, blustering about "my shrubberies" and other trivial affairs. The cinematography is lush (several breathtaking tracking shots are used, especially early on), as are the period costumes. The production was filmed exclusively on location, and the reality of the sets enforces the story.', 'Some fans may prefer the', '1995 Amanda Root version', ', for the casting of Ciaran Hinds as Capt. Wentworth, but this later effort is a worthy entry in the Austen film oeuvre--and Rupert Penry-Jones is a dreamboat in his own right. As the wistful Anne says, on behalf of all women, "We do not forget you, so soon as you forget us." --', 'A.T. Hurley']

raw_response:
SUMMARY:  
The individual demonstrates a strong preference for romantic and historically-themed films, particularly adaptations of classic literature. Consistently high ratings (averaging above 4.5) for adaptations indicate a sentimental connection to familiar narratives and characters, as seen in their focus on Jane Austen and classic French literature. The person values high-quality production, strong performances, and attention to detail in cinematography and period settings. 

They exhibit a preference for DVDs over streaming formats, suggesting an appreciation for physical collections and potentially a desire for nostalgia or tangible ownership. Price sensitivity is not explicitly evident in the average ratings, as they tend to rate highly regardless of the collection’s price or format, implying a willingness to invest in quality.

The patterns show that while they enjoy mainstream films, there's also an openness to lesser-known titles, evidenced by their positive feedback on independent or art-house films. Family-friendly content, like children’s programming, receives equal acclaim, underscoring a role as a family-oriented buyer.

Overall, this person gravitates towards emotionally resonant narratives and high production values in romantic and historical contexts, while also engaging with family-oriented media for younger audiences.

target_interaction.title: Blue Clues Cute Viewing
target_interaction.text: I did not watch the entire Blue's Clues Season 4 show. But my little five-year-old granddaughter enjoyed it. Kids help Blue find clues. Ages 2—4,
